column2: Whole grain bread, Avocado, Salt, Pepper, Red pepper flakes, Cherry tomatoes, Olive oil
column4: 2. Mash avocado and spread it evenly on the toast.
column5: 3. Sprinkle with salt pepper and red pepper flakes to taste.
column6: 4. Optionally top with sliced cherry tomatoes and a drizzle of olive oil.

column2: Greek yogurt, Granola (nut-free), Mixed berries (such as strawberries, blueberries, raspberries), Honey
column3: 1. In a bowl or glass layer Greek yogurt and granola.
column4: 2. Add a layer of mixed berries.
column5: 3. Repeat layers until the container is filled.

column2: Oats, Almond milk (nut-free), Berries (such as strawberries, blueberries, raspberries), Chia seeds, Maple syrup
column3: 1. Cook oats according to package instructions using almond milk.
column4: 2. Once cooked top with mixed berries and chia seeds.
column5: 3. Drizzle with maple syrup if desired.

column2: Frozen mixed berries, Banana, Spinach, Greek yogurt (nut-free), Almond milk (nut-free), Chia seeds, Honey
column3: 1. In a blender combine frozen mixed berries banana spinach Greek yogurt almond milk and chia seeds.
column5: 3. Pour into a bowl and top with a drizzle of honey.

column2: Eggs, Bell peppers, Onion, Spinach, Tomato, Olive oil, Salt, Pepper
column3: 1. Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat.
column4: 2. Saute diced bell peppers onions and spinach until tender.
column5: 3. Add beaten eggs to the skillet and cook until set.
column6: 4. Add diced tomatoes and season with salt and pepper.
column7: 5. Fold the omelette and serve hot.

column2: Quinoa, Mixed vegetables (such as cucumber, bell peppers, cherry tomatoes, red onion), Chickpeas, Lemon juice, Olive oil, Salt, Pepper, Fresh herbs (such as parsley, cilantro)
column3: 1. Cook quinoa according to package instructions and let it cool.
column4: 2. In a large bowl combine cooked quinoa mixed vegetables and chickpeas.
column5: 3. Drizzle with lemon juice and olive oil and season with salt pepper and fresh herbs.
column6: 4. Toss to combine and serve chilled.

column2: Tomatoes, Fresh mozzarella cheese, Fresh basil leaves, Balsamic glaze, Olive oil, Salt, Pepper
column3: 1. Slice tomatoes and fresh mozzarella cheese into rounds.
column4: 2. Arrange tomato and mozzarella slices on a plate alternating and overlapping them.
column5: 3. Tuck fresh basil leaves in between the tomato and mozzarella slices.
column6: 4. Drizzle with balsamic glaze and olive oil.
column7: 5. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

column2: Mixed vegetables (such as bell peppers, broccoli, carrots, snap peas), Tofu, Soy sauce, Garlic, Ginger, Olive oil, Sesame seeds, Green onions
column3: 1. Heat olive oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat.
column4: 2. Add minced garlic and ginger and cook until fragrant.
column5: 3. Add sliced tofu and cook until lightly browned.
column6: 4. Add mixed vegetables and stir-fry until tender-crisp.
column7: 5. Stir in soy sauce and cook for another minute.
column8: 6. Garnish with sesame seeds and chopped green onions before serving.

column2: Cooked rice, Black beans, Corn, Avocado, Cherry tomatoes, Red onion, Cilantro, Lime, Salt, Pepper, Salsa, Greek yogurt (optional)
column3: 1. In a bowl layer cooked rice black beans corn diced avocado halved cherry tomatoes diced red onion and chopped cilantro.
column4: 2. Squeeze fresh lime juice over the bowl and season with salt and pepper.
column5: 3. Serve with salsa and a dollop of Greek yogurt if desired.

column1: Spinach and Feta Stuffed Portobello Mushrooms
column2: Portobello mushrooms, Spinach, Feta cheese, Garlic, Olive oil, Salt, Pepper
column4: 2. Remove the stems from portobello mushrooms and gently scrape out the gills.
column5: 3. In a skillet heat olive oil over medium heat and sauté minced garlic until fragrant.
column6: 4. Add spinach to the skillet and cook until wilted.
column7: 5. Fill each mushroom cap with the cooked spinach mixture and crumbled feta cheese.
column8: 6. Place stuffed mushrooms on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
column9: 7. Bake in the preheated oven for 15-20 minutes or until mushrooms are tender.

column2: Black beans, Kidney beans, Diced tomatoes, Onion, Bell peppers, Corn, Garlic, Chili powder, Cumin, Paprika, Salt, Pepper
column3: 1. In a large pot heat olive oil over medium heat.
column4: 2. Add diced onion bell peppers and minced garlic to the pot and cook until softened.
column5: 3. Stir in chili powder cumin paprika salt and pepper and cook for another minute.
column6: 4. Add diced tomatoes black beans kidney beans and corn to the pot along with any desired additional vegetables.
column7: 5. Bring the chili to a simmer and let it cook for about 20-30 minutes stirring occasionally.
column8: 6. Serve hot garnished with toppings like chopped cilantro diced avocado or shredded cheese if desired.

column2: Arborio rice, Vegetable broth, Onion, Bell peppers, Tomatoes, Green beans, Peas, Garlic, Saffron threads, Paprika, Salt, Pepper, Lemon wedges
column3: 1. In a large skillet or paella pan heat olive oil over medium heat.
column4: 2. Add diced onion and bell peppers to the pan and cook until softened.
column5: 3. Stir in minced garlic saffron threads and paprika and cook until fragrant.
column6: 4. Add Arborio rice to the pan and toast for a few minutes.
column7: 5. Pour in vegetable broth and diced tomatoes and season with salt and pepper.
column8: 6. Arrange green beans and peas on top of the rice mixture.
column9: 7. Cover the skillet and let the paella simmer for about 20-25 minutes or until the rice is cooked and the liquid is absorbed.
column10: 8. Serve hot with lemon wedges on the side.

column2: Eggplant, Marinara sauce, Mozzarella cheese, Parmesan cheese, Italian seasoning, Bread crumbs, Olive oil, Salt, Pepper
column4: 2. Slice eggplant into rounds and sprinkle with salt. Let it sit for about 10 minutes then pat dry with paper towels.
column5: 3. Dip eggplant slices into beaten eggs then coat with bread crumbs mixed with Italian seasoning.
column6: 4. Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat and cook eggplant slices until golden brown on both sides.
column7: 5. In a baking dish spread a layer of marinara sauce then arrange a layer of cooked eggplant slices.
column8: 6. Sprinkle with grated mozzarella and Parmesan cheese.
column9: 7. Repeat the layers until all ingredients are used ending with a layer of cheese on top.
column10: 8. Bake in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
column11: 9. Serve hot garnished with fresh basil if desired.

column2: Mixed vegetables (such as cauliflower, carrots, potatoes, peas), Coconut milk, Curry paste, Onion, Garlic, Ginger, Olive oil, Salt, Pepper, Fresh cilantro, Lime wedges
column3: 1. In a large pot heat olive oil over medium heat.
column4: 2. Add diced onion minced garlic and grated ginger to the pot and cook until softened.
column5: 3. Stir in curry paste and cook for another minute.
column6: 4. Add mixed vegetables to the pot and stir to coat them with the curry mixture.
column7: 5. Pour in coconut milk and season with salt and pepper.
column8: 6. Bring the curry to a simmer and let it cook for about 20-25 minutes or until the vegetables are tender.
column9: 7. Serve hot garnished with fresh cilantro and lime wedges.
